raw_text:
Johnny Depp: The acting outlaw
 
 Johnny Depp, whose latest role was Peter Pan creator JM Barrie in Finding Neverland, is celebrated as one of Hollywood's most maverick talents. Depp has become an unlikely major star, given his preference for taking dark and idiosyncratic roles instead of surefire box office hits. He has had a long-running working relationship with the equally unconventional director Tim Burton. Depp was born in Kentucky in 1963 and at first wanted to be a rock star, playing in a number of bands and supporting acts such as Iggy Pop and The B-52s in Florida. On a visit to Los Angeles, his former wife introduced him to actor Nicolas Cage.
 
 In 1984 he started his film career playing a doomed teenager in horror film Nightmare On Elm Street. Two years later he played a soldier in Oliver Stone's Vietnam epic Platoon. But it was TV that first made Depp a star. He played undercover cop Tommy Hanson in the US series 21 Jump Street for three years from 1987.
 
 In 1990 he began his partnership with Burton in the dark fairy tale Edward Scissorhands, about a young man with blades for hands. He won plaudits in 1993 for the downbeat film What's Eating Gilbert Grape, where he played a sensitive youth looking after an overweight mother and a retarded younger brother, played by Leonardo DiCaprio. Another role under Burton, Ed Wood, starred Depp as the crazed cult film-maker Wood, in 1994. He played a much more serious, sensitive role in his next major film, Donnie Brasco, where he portrayed an undercover cop infiltrating a mafia ring. In 1997 he directed his only film to date - The Brave, the story of an Indian man offered money to appear in a snuff film.
 
 Two years later he played Hunter S Thompson in Terry Gilliam's ambitious but poorly-received big screen adaptation of Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas. He worked again with Tim Burton in the 1999 horror film Sleepy Hollow, and appeared opposite Dame Judi Dench and Juliette Binoche in Chocolat. His performance in Pirates of the Caribbean, which earned him Golden Globe and Bafta nominations, had many critics thinking he based it upon the mannerisms of his friend, Rolling Stones guitarist Keith Richards. His latest role in Finding Neverland explored JM Barrie's relationship with Sylvia (Kate Winslet) and her children. Depp's charismatic performance drew an audience of adults and children alike into Barrie's vivid imagination, and he was called the "fifth child of the group" by the film's director Marc Forster.
 
 He has two children of his own with French singer Vanessa Paradis, having previously been in a long-term relationship with British model Kate Moss. The theme of children's literature in Depp's career - and his long association with Tim Burton - are set to continue in his next role, playing Willy Wonka in a remake of Roald Dahl's classic Charlie and the Chocolate Factory. British TV comedy fans might also remember Depp's guest role in the final episode of BBC sketch programme The Fast Show, cited as his favourite show. It was another surprise move in Depp's varied and intriguing career.
llama3.2:1b: Johnny Depp is a Hollywood star known for taking unconventional roles such as actors Nicolas Cage and Tim Burton. He started his film career playing horror films like Nightmare on Elm Street and Platoon before becoming a household name with Edward Scissorhands, What's Eating Gilbert Grape, Donnie Brasco, Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas, Sleepy Hollow, Pirates of the Caribbean, Finding Neverland, and Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.
llama3.2:3b: Johnny Depp is a maverick actor known for taking dark and idiosyncratic roles. Born in Kentucky in 1963, he initially wanted to be a rock star but instead became an actor after being introduced to Nicolas Cage. He gained popularity through TV shows like "21 Jump Street" and films like "Edward Scissorhands" with director Tim Burton. Depp's career includes roles in "Platoon", "What's Eating Gilbert Grape", "Donnie Brasco", "Sleepy Hollow", and "Pirates of the Caribbean". He has won numerous awards, including Golden Globe nominations, for his performances.
gemma2:2b: Johnny Depp is a renowned actor known for his unconventional roles and collaborations with director Tim Burton. His career began with horror films like Nightmare On Elm Street, before gaining prominence through TV series 21 Jump Street. He gained acclaim for dark fairy tales, independent films, and performances in comedies and action genres. Notable films include "Edward Scissorhands,"  "What's Eating Gilbert Grape," "Donnie Brasco," and "Sleepy Hollow." Depp has also directed a film ("The Brave"). His latest role was as JM Barrie in Finding Neverland.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Johnny Depp is a dark and idiosyncratic actor who has had a long-standing working relationship with Tim Burton. He began his film career with Nightmare On Elm Street before becoming a main cast member of Edward Scissorhands, which he later directed and starred in. In 1990, he worked with Burton on the dark fairy tale "Edward Scissorhands", where he portrayed Tommy Hanson as a young man with blades for hands. He has two children with French singer Vanessa Paradis.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Johnny Depp is an unconventional actor known for playing dark, idiosyncratic roles rather than mainstream hits, having worked closely with director Tim Burton since 1984 on films like Edward Scissorhands and Sleepy Hollow. He starred as Hunter S. Thompson in Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas alongside Terry Gilliam in 1999's Sleepy Hollow. Depp directed his first film, The Brave, and played Donnie Brasco in the undercover cop thriller of the same year. His latest role was portraying Peter Pan creator JM Barrie in Finding Neverland, showcasing his ability to captivate audiences with a compelling performance that appealed equally to adults and children.
qwen2.5:3b: Johnny Depp, known for his dark and unconventional roles, is a celebrated maverick talent in Hollywood. Born in 1963, he initially aimed to be a rock star but later started his film career with the horror movie "Nightmare on Elm Street" in 1984. He has worked extensively with director Tim Burton, appearing in films like "Edward Scissorhands," "What's Eating Gilbert Grape," and "Ed Wood." Depp gained further recognition for roles in TV series such as "21 Jump Street" (as Tommy Hanson) and films like "Donnie Brasco," "Pirates of the Caribbean," and "Finding Neverland," where he played Peter Pan creator JM Barrie. He has two children with Vanessa Paradis, who models a theme of children's literature in his career. Upcoming projects include playing Willy Wonka in "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory."
opencoder:1.5b: Johnny Depp: His acting debut as the outlaw, in 1984. In the 1990s, he continued his career with a film called What's Eating Gilbert Grape that portrayed an undercover cop as a fat, retarded man who tried to eat people. Another film, Sleepy Hollow, also aired for fans of British comedy, where he played Hunter S Thompson with a group from the 19th century. Depp's love interest, Terry Gilliam's adaptation of Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas, is now on TV again. The film has gained considerable acclaim due to its uncanny mannerisms and the scenes that it explores. In Depp's final role as a fifth child, he played Willy Wonka with the characters Kate Winslet and Sylvia Mohr. A few years later, he continued his film career in a remake of Roald Dahl's classic Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, which earned him Golden Globe and Bafta nominations.

<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about Johnny Depp. Let me read through it carefully.

The first paragraph introduces Johnny Depp, who plays an "acting outlaw" and is a maverick performer in Hollywood. He started out as a rock star before moving into film roles. He was born in Kentucky and had a long association with Tim Burton. His early career included horror films like Nightmare On Elm Street and Platoon on TV.

Then he moved to the movies, starting Edward Scissorhands but made it big in What's Eating Gilbert Grape. He did Donnie Brasco and directed The Brave. He played Hunter S Thompson in a film adaptation of Fear and Loathing, worked with Tim Burton again, and starred in Pirates of the Caribbean. His latest role was Finding Neverland with Sylvia (Kate Winslet).

He has two kids with Vanessa Paradis and has guested on "The Fast Show," which is a British sketch program. His work in Roald Dahl's movie and his varied career are highlighted.

I need to make sure I capture all key points: his acting style, roles across genres, his relationship with Tim Burton, his recent work, and some specific details about his family and appearances on TV shows.

I should start by stating that Johnny Depp is a unique performer. Then mention his diverse roles in horror,TV, and comedy, along with his connection to Tim Burton's themes of dark themes and children's literature. Include his relationship with Tim Burton and the themes he shared. Mention his recent role in Finding Neverland and how it drew audiences into JM Barrie's story.

I should make sure not to mention anything about his past TV roles like "The Fast Show," but perhaps note that he had other commitments as well.

Putting it all together concisely without any explanations or extra details.
</think>

Johnny Depp is a unique performer, known for his blend of acting outlaw style and varied roles across genres. He started as an aspiring rock star before transitioning into Hollywood's innovative world, notably with his work on horror films like Nightmare On Elm Street and Platoon on TV. His career expanded significantly with roles in Edward Scissorhands, The Brave, Hunter S Thompson (in Fear and Loathing), Donnie Brasco, and finding a role in Finding Neverland exploring JM Barrie's relationship with Sylvia (Kate Winslet). He shares themes of dark and sensitive narratives with Tim Burton's films, particularly through his involvement in "The Fast Show," despite occasional guest roles on British sketch programs. Depp is celebrated for his diverse career, which also includes his work on Roald Dahl's Charlie and the Chocolate Factory and his exploration of children's literature.
tinyllama:1.1b: The acting outlaw Johnny Depp has become known for his dark and idiosyncratic roles rather than surefire box office hits. Depp's recent work includes playing Peter Pan creator JM Barrie in the film Findin' Neverland, which won praise from critics and audiences alike. The actor's previous works include voicing a soldier in Oliver Stone's Platoon, undercover cop Tommy Hanson in Oliver Stone's Vieñamare Street for three years, playing Edward Scissorhands in What's Eating Gilbert Grape with Leonardo DiCaprio, and portraying Donnie Brasco under Tim Burton. His most recent film is The Brave (2013), which stars him as an undercover cop infilling a mafiya ring in Italy, and his role in Choocholat (2016) which won him Golden Globe and Bafta nominations for his performance. Depp's latest role in Findin' Neverland is his fifth collaboration with Tim Burton, and he has two children of his own with Vanessa Paradis, playing the titular character in the Charlie and the Chocolate Factory remake.

He has a long-standing working relationship with director Tim Burton, who collaborated on several films including Edward Scissorhands, What's Eating Gilbert Grape, Donnie Brasco, Sleepy Hollow, Finding Neverland and Pirates of the Caribbean. Depp has acted in dark fairy tales like Edward Scissorhands, What's Eating Gilbert Grape and Donnie Brasco, while also exploring children's literature with his two children with model Vanessa Paradis. Overall, Johnny Depp is an influential actor known for creating unique and unconventional roles, cementing him as one of Hollywood's most maverick talents.

His latest role is as Peter Pan creator JM Barrie's son in Finding Neverland. He later appeared in Oliver Stone's Vietnam epic Platoon and also starred in the TV series 21 Jump Street. Depp has won plaudits for his portrayal of a sensitive youth in What's Eating Gilbert Grape, and for playing a delusional man in Ed Wood. In Donnie Brasco, he directed his only film. He played Hunter S Thompson in Terry Gilliam's poorly-received big screen adaptation of Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas, and starred opposite Dame Judi Dench and Juliette Binoche in Chocolat. His performance in Pirates of the Caribbean drew critics' attention to his mannerisms, which were based on Rolling Stones guitarist Keith Richards. Born in Kentucky in 1963, he initially aspired to be a rock star but turned to acting after meeting Nicolas Cage in Los Angeles. His film career began with horror roles like Nightmare On Elm Street and Platoon before launching him to stardom as Tommy Hanson in 20th Century F TV series 21 Jump Street.

Depp collaborated with Tim Burton on several dark fairy tales, including Edward Scissorhands (1990), What's Eating Gilbert Grape (1993), and the cult film Ed Wood (1994). He demonstrated versatility in roles such as Donnie Brasco (1997) and Hunter S Thompson in Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (2001). Depp also directed The Brave, a film about an Indian man offered money for participation in a snuff film.

His Golden Globe and Bafta nominations came with roles in Pirates of the Caribbean (2003) and Finding Neverland (2004), where he portrayed JM Barrie's relationship with Sylvia and her children, earning him praise for his charismatic performance. Depp has two children from his long-term relationship with French singer Vanessa Paradis.

Depp's future projects include a remake of Charlie and the Chocolate Factory as Willy Wonka and another Tim Burton collaboration, this time directing rather than acting. His career, marked by unconventional roles and a fondness for children's literature, has been marked by appearances in various British TV shows, including The Fast Show.
